com.github.bjarneh.utilz

Class io

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.bjarneh.utilz.io

  • public class io
extends Object
    Common io functions. 
    
  // Typical use:

  byte[] bytes;
  
  // fetch file as raw byte array
  bytes = io.raw("somefile.txt");

  // fetch URL as raw byte array
  bytes = io.wget("http://example.com/index.html");

  // fetch stdin as raw byte array
  bytes = io.raw(System.in);

  // pipe an input stream to an output stream (stdin to stdout)
  io.pipe(System.in, System.out);
    note: There is a lot of comments here since this is meant to be a library with some documentation, i.e. make sure you turn on your comment folding before you start reading this file.

      • raw

        public static byte[] raw(FileInputStream stream)
                  throws IOException
        In memory raw file slurp. It should be noted that I'm just guessing that this is the best way to do things based on votes from stackoverflow, which could very well be wrong; but if it is I'm not alone :-) stackoverflow: 326390
        Parameters:
        stream - to slurp and return as raw bytes
        Returns:
        a byte array containing the bytes of the stream
        Throws:
        IOException

      • raw

        a byte array containing the bytes of the input stream
